subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p:
Mavento is a project to build, test and deploy Magento projects with Maven. It was started to achieve continous integration for Magento projects, but has since matured into a solid toolbox for Magento developers of all kind. The magento-maven-plugin provides Magento specific goals which can be plugged into the Maven build life cycle or run from any shell. The magento-archetypes provide ready to run Maven projects configured for Magento development.
All projects are open source and can be found on github .

subsection.name: Why Maven?
subsection.p:
Imagine a world where every project can be configured, build, tested and deployed in exactly the same way. A world where any developer or user can simply checkout the project source, run the same single command and start working. A mystical place where dependencies, like the Magento core files, no longer need to pollute your source repository to get a repeatable build.
Joking aside, such are the goals of Maven, a software project management and comprehension tool that aims at providing a uniform and easy build process. It is very popular in the Java world, but can handle any type of project, be it java, c++, php, ios, simple static html or even authoring a print book.
Apart from this holistic approach, Maven follows the convention over configuration paradigm and has excellent dependency management, which is what makes Maven so different from build tools like ant or make. The benefits of Maven are substantial once you have to work/integrate with a bunch of different projects or your organisation grows.

ul.li: Keep your source files separated from the Magento runtime at all time.
Consistent development environment between all involved devs.
PHP code validation/unit tests via maven-php-plugin.
Flexible automated Magento setup of vanilla or custom instances.
Create snapshots of running Magento instances to be used as base for testing/development.
Less boilerplate Magento code to write with ready to run module templates and code snippets.
Multi module support for bigger projects. Reactorbuilds. <3
Dead easy project integration into CI servers like Jenkins.
